item.source: Taco bell customer accidentally gets handed $2,000 instead of burrito @drivethru

item.title: Taco bell customer accidentally gets handed $2,000 instead of burrito @drivethru
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:12, topic:340514”][quote author=Original Daniel link=topic=436883.msg3217063#msg3217063 date=1274765705]

how fucking stupid are cops, contacting the driver behind the car, to ask if they got the license plate number? LOL.

It would have been routine, they probably just wanted a description of the person.
[/quote]
Routine or not, there’s absolutely nothing noteworthy or unusual about someone receiving a bag of something from a drive through window.
I’d certainly have no reason to commit their licence plate to memory, and neither would anyone else.[/quote]

It would have been dumber if they didn’t ask while they were talking to them, and they just happened to have memorized it.

Read full topic
item.source: Taco bell customer accidentally gets handed $2,000 instead of burrito @drivethru

item.source: Taco bell customer accidentally gets handed $2,000 instead of burrito @drivethru

item.title: Taco bell customer accidentally gets handed $2,000 instead of burrito @drivethru
item.dc:creator: @Bebemycat2 Bebe
item.description:
@Bebemycat2 wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:12, topic:340514”][quote author=Original Daniel link=topic=436883.msg3217063#msg3217063 date=1274765705]

how fucking stupid are cops, contacting the driver behind the car, to ask if they got the license plate number? LOL.

It would have been routine, they probably just wanted a description of the person.
[/quote]
Routine or not, there’s absolutely nothing noteworthy or unusual about someone receiving a bag of something from a drive through window.
I’d certainly have no reason to commit their licence plate to memory, and neither would anyone else.[/quote]
When I’m in traffic and bored (everyday cause this city sucks) I stare at license plates and try to memorize them. Weird habit from when I was a kid and we would be on car trips. So it isn’t out of the question that the person behind them could at least remember a partial of the license. But yes, still stupid of the cops.

Read full topic

how fucking stupid are cops, contacting the driver behind the car, to ask if they got the license plate number? LOL.
[/quote]

It would have been routine, they probably just wanted a description of the person.[/quote]
Routine or not, there’s absolutely nothing noteworthy or unusual about someone receiving a bag of something from a drive through window.
I’d certainly have no reason to commit their licence plate to memory, and neither would anyone else.
